Articles.Content:
Just updated to newest version of ksp (steam) and was playing it fine all day yesterday. Today, when trying to load it up, all i get is a white screen for a few seconds, then an error message saying my game crashed. 

[http://www./view/zpj41k7kam34btt/output_log.txt](http://www./view/zpj41k7kam34btt/output_log.txt)

I looks like KSP can't use your graphics card.

    Direct3D:    Version:  Direct3D 9.0c [nvumdshim.dll 9.18.13.4052]    Renderer: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 765M     Vendor:   NVIDIA    VRAM:     1990 MB (via DXGI)    Caps:     Shader=30 DepthRT=1 NativeDepth=1 NativeShadow=1 DF16=0 INTZ=1 RAWZ=0 NULL=1 RESZ=0 SlowINTZ=0d3d: creation params: flags=44 swap=1 vsync=80000000 w=314 h=206 fmt=21 bbcount=1 dsformat=75 pflags=0d3d: failed to create device [queried technique not available]D3D9 initialization failedGfxDevice: creating device client; threaded=1d3d11: failed to create D3D11 device (0x8007000e)D3D11 initialization failedD3D9/D3D11 initialization failed, trying OpenGLGfxDevice: creating device client; threaded=1OpenGL:    Version:  OpenGL 4.4 [4.4.0]    Renderer: GeForce GTX 765M/PCIe/SSE2    Vendor:   NVIDIA Corporation    VRAM:     1990 MB (via DXGI)    Extensions: (snipped)GL: Detected 0 MB VRAMGLContext: failed to activate 10000: The requested resource is in use.

Please make sure your graphics driver is installed and up to dateand that you are not using a powersaving mode, also don't alt+tab out while KSP loads just in case it's that ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
